metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7141 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
curl and libcurl before 7.50.2, when built with NSS and the libnsspem.solibrary is available at runtime, allow remote attackers to hijack theauthentication of a TLS connection by leveraging reuse of a previouslyloaded client certificate from file for a connection for which nocertificate has been set, a different vulnerability than CVE-2016-5420.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7141` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.2
libcurl3 - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.2
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.2
libcurl3-nss - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: curl package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.47.0-1ubuntu2.2').
